title: Fundamental Theorem with derivative of integral

content.question: Let g be the function defined by <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mtext> </mtext></mrow> </math>dt. On which of the following intervals is g decreasing?

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
